title: Salkantay Trek
itinerary:
Day 1 Cusco
Arrive at any time.

Day 2 Cusco / Wayraqmachay
Transfer to the start of the trail and begin the Salkantay Trek.Stunning views and Inca ruins fill the days as you hike past the striking peaks of Salkantay,
Humantay,
and Ausangate,
among others.Traverse high passes the highest point reaching 4,
600 m(15, 092 ft) before descending into valleys nestled in the mountains.Spend the nights camping under the stars.Enjoy the spectacular mountain scenery and breathtaking views as the trek descends from the heights of the Andes to the lush subtropics surrounding Machu Picchu.

Meals included: Breakfast | Lunch | Dinner
Day 3 Salkantaypampa / Sahuayaco
Continue the trek downhill,
passing through the town of Collpabamba on the way to Chaullay.Hike along the Sahuayaco River through lush cloud forest to your campsite
for the evening,
Playa Sahuayaco.

Meals included: Breakfast | Lunch | Dinner
Day 4 Sahuayaco / Aguas Calientes
Hike to the Inca site Llaqtapata,
where you can
catch your first glimpse of Machu Picchu.Catch the train in the afternoon to Aguas Calientes.

Meals included: Breakfast | Lunch
Day 5 Aguas Calientes / Cusco
Enjoy a guided tour of Machu Picchu.Optional visit to the Inca Bridge and
return to Cusco in the evening where the tour ends upon arrival.

Meals included: Breakfast
description: Salkantay has been dubbed the most spectacular peak in the Peruvian Andes. On this trip, you’ll trek in the shadows of this impressive mountain, interact with its inhabitants, and explore its forgotten ruins. Catch the train to Aguas Calientes for an early-morning visit to Machu Picchu.

images.title: Dip your feet in the beautiful glacial lake of Humantay
Visit the lesser-known picturesque ruins of Llactapata
Explore the fabled sanctuary of Machu Picchu
Cross over the 4660m Salkantay pass before descending into the cloud forest

title: Lima Walking Tour
itinerary: You will then walk to the Main Square of Lima, the perfect place to hear about the history of the city. Here you will see the Cathedral of Lima, City Hall, the Archbishop's Palace, and the Government Palace, where you can enjoy the change of the guard. You will also have the option of seeing Pizarro’s remains at the Museum of the Cathedral.
description: Enjoy some of the most historic colonial sites in Peru and discover all the rich history and culture that the “City of Kings” has to offer. You find yourself feeling like you’ve been swept back in time as you visit the old colonial mansion, Casa Aliaga, and the Hotel Bolivar with its same 1920s decor. These are visits you cannot afford to miss when discovering Peru’s interesting past!
included: Entrance ticket to the Cathedral Museum or the Saint Francis Museum
One alcoholic drink (Pisco sour, Peruvian beer, or chicha de jora) or non-alcoholic drink (chicha morada or Inca Kola)
